page.title: 04A. DRAKE, HONLEY CRICKETER
page.content: {Alonzo Drake,}the {Yorkshire }left arm bowler of slow medium pace, spent much of his life in Honley. He was also a powerful left-handed batsman. Drake's career in county cricket spanned a period of 9 years. Apart from his prowess on the field, Drake won the affection of his colleagues with a droll sense of humour. Memories of this great cricketer linger on. In 1914, at Weston, he ran riot against Somerset with figures of 5 wickets for 16 runs and 10 wickets for 35 runs. These 15 wickets were taken in a mere 15.5 overs. Seven of those wickets came in 20 balls. In his career Drake 3 times took 3 wickets in for balls. Alonzo died suddenly in 1919 at the age of 35. He is buried in Honley village.
